titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to "Joe's Dope" Chapter 5, by Joe Smith (photocopy) circa 1950-1980
titlestmt.author: James Feller

publicationstmt.publisher: Manuscripts, Archives, and Special Collections, Washington State University Libraries

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2018-07-18.
profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid based on DACS 2nd Edition ( Describing Archives: A Content Standard).

repository.corpname: Manuscripts, Archives, and Special Collections, Washington State University Libraries

did.abstract: This collection consists of a photocopy of chapter five of Joe Smith's unpublished autobiography, "Joe's Dope."

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of a single item, "Joe's Dope" Chapter 5, by Joe Smith (photocopy), reproduced from a document in the Joe Smith Papers at the University of Washington.

bioghist.p: Joe Smith was a farmer, political activist, and journalist in Washington State. Smith was born in Missouri in 1872, and his family moved to Endicott, Washington in 1883. Although he attended Missouri State University (now the University of Missouri), Smith completed his formal education at Washington Agricultural College (now Washington State University). The chapter of his autobiography found in this collection details his time at the university and his impressions of college president E.A. Bryan.

accessrestrict.p: This collection is open and available for research use.

userestrict.p: Copyright restrictions apply; no reproduction without permission of the University of Washington Libraries.

processinfo.p: James Feller processed this collection in 2018.

acqinfo.p: Linley Gumm donated this collection to the Washington State University Libraries in 2006 (MS.2006.27).

prefercite.p: "Joe's Dope" Chapter 5, by Joe Smith; Manuscripts, Archives, and Special Collections, Washington State University Libraries; Pullman, WA.
